description: Demolition of existing office building and public house and erection of four storey mixed use development, comprising of part restaurant/bar and office on ground floor, office on the upper floor, basement parking and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is continued, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matter which have been given in this application.   Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Dustbin and enclosed refuse area, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any works, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where palladins are employed) from an adopted highway.  Reason: To comply with the Council's Design Guides. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works to include details of access to garden area for each of the sixteen units, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the phased programme agrees by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The schedule shall include details of its arrangement for its implementation. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  Reason: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character of the area. | Details of external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing. The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of the building and maintenance in accordance with these standards thereafter.  Reason : To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | The vertical illuminance of any lighting at the nearest affected fatade shall be controlled to a maximum of 10 lux at the ground floor level and 5 lux at first floor level and the main beam angle of all lights shall not exceed 70 degrees.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking and showering facilities for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before first occupation of the use hereby permitted and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details before the first occupation and permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | Details requiring all occupiers of the proposed building to submit a detailed Green Travel Plan within the context of the Green Travel Plan submitted by the Sellar Property Group, designed to manage the transport needs of staff to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of any work on site.  The approved scheme shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that the Council's policies on sustainability are met. | Prior to the commencement of development, details of the design of the buildings and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas siting to comply with the requirements of Secure by Design shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupations of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers | Details of the highway works to be carried out by the developer shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning authority prior to commencement of works. Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained. No development shall be place until such access has been constructed in accordance with approved details.  Reason: In the interests of highway safety.
